title: Indonesia’s Election to Shape Reform Agenda in Post-Jokowi Era
description: Indonesians are voting in an election that has turned outgoing President Joko Widodo into a polarizing figure amid mounting backlash over moves to get his preferred successor in power to continue his policies.

title: Inflation’s Not Fading as Election Year Issue for Biden Anytime Soon
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics enterprise reporter Rich Miller breaks down the consumer price index. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Yellen Calls Trump’s NATO Dismissal a Threat to Global Economy
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said recent remarks by former President Donald Trump sowing doubt about US commitments to NATO partners could undermine an alliance central to global economic stability.

title: Biden’s Top Latin America Adviser Juan Gonzalez to Step Down
description: President Joe Biden’s top Latin America adviser is stepping down, a move that may complicate a US push for democratic reforms in Venezuela in exchange for sanctions relief.

title: Biden Criticizes Trump’s ‘Dangerous’ NATO Threat, Pushes Ukraine Aid
description: President Joe Biden assailed former President Donald Trump for threatening to allow Russia to invade NATO allies, while imploring Republicans to pass fresh aid for Ukraine.

title: South Africa May Need to Hike Value-Added Tax in Next Budget, PwC Says
description: South Africa’s National Treasury may have to hike value-added tax on some goods and services to bring in new revenues, accounting firm PwC said.

title: Santander Says Internal Review Finds No Breach of US Sanctions
description: Banco Santander SA said an internal review of accounts that were reported to be secretly held by an Iranian petrochemicals company did not find any breach of US sanctions.

title: Ukraine Aid Crashes Headlong Into US House Standoff Over Border
description: Any relief felt in Kyiv over the US Senate’s pre-dawn passage of Ukraine war aid will almost certainly be short-lived. The legislation has no chance of advancing in the US House anytime soon.

title: Pakistan Party Nominates Shehbaz Sharif as PM, Ending Deadlock
description: Former Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif was nominated as Pakistan’s next premier after a rival group pledged support, ending a deadlock in the formation of a government following national elections last week that delivered a split mandate.

title: Why Rafah Is Raising Fears in Israel’s War With Hamas
description: Israel’s military is preparing an offensive on the southern Gazan city of Rafah, the latest step in the campaign aimed at eradicating Hamas, the Iran-backed militant group behind the Oct. 7 attack, in which 1,200 people were killed and 250 more were abducted. The prospect of another major assault has drawn criticism from the US and other countries, as concerns rise over the fate of 1 million Palestinian refugees who have sought refuge in the enclave’s one remaining safe haven.

title: Yellen Says Biden ‘Very Effective’ in Summits With World Leaders
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen defended President Joe Biden in the face of concerns over his mental acuity, citing his resilience during his November tête-à-tête with Chinese President Xi Jinping and in other meetings with world leaders.

title: Housing Minister Banks on Canada Rate Cuts to Spur Building Boom
description: Canada’s housing minister says he believes lower interest rates will encourage builders to ramp up their activity, alleviating the country’s crunched supply of homes.

title: Swedish Banks to Boost Security as Gangs Target Digital Offering
description: Sweden’s largest lenders have pledged to adjust product offerings and increase surveillance amid a surge in fraud by organized crime groups taking advantage of the country’s highly digitalized banking sector.

title: Yellen Touts Inflation Progress Despite Stubborn January Gains
description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen touted progress in bringing down inflation even as the latest monthly data pointed to stubborn price gains — including across several key household expenses.

title: Israel’s Faceoff With Moody’s Over Rating Downgrade Ignored by Markets
description: Israel is in a pique over its first-ever rating downgrade that’s so far left markets unmoved but led to worry the government’s standing with investors could suffer as it embarks on near-record borrowing to fund the war.

title: France Seeks Equitable Cost Sharing on EDF’s UK Reactor Projects
description: France wants the British government to share the cost of developing new nuclear reactors in the UK, said Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire.

title: Turkey Has List of Asks for Rutte Before It’ll OK His NATO Bid
description: Turkey wants reassurances from Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte before Ankara will approve his bid to be the next head of NATO.

title: Candidate Controversy: How Does Labour Move On From Antisemitism?
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Norway’s Finance Minister Says Worry Over High Inflation Easing
description: The Norwegian economy is “on track to a calmer place,” with a strong labor market underpinning a soft-landing case, according to the fossil-fuel-rich country’s finance minister.

title: Mexico’s Pemex Gets Billions in Tax Relief in AMLO Decree
description: Mexico’s government exempted state-owned Petroleos Mexicanos from a series of taxes for a period of four months, effectively giving the debt-ridden company billions of dollars more in liquidity.

title: Islamic State Raids Mozambique Town as Total Plans LNG Return
description: Islamic State-linked fighters carried out their deadliest attack on Mozambican troops since 2021, according to a researcher, ratcheting up security concerns ahead of TotalEnergies SE’s planned return to build a $20 billion liquefied natural gas project.

title: Extrajudicial Killings Leave 66 Dead in Ethiopia, Group Says
description: Government security forces killed at least 60 civilians in an attack in Ethiopia’s northern Amhara region last month, a state-run human rights body said.

title: Sharif’s Party to Pick Pakistan PM as Bhutto Supports Alliance
description: Pakistan is a step closer to getting a new government after an influential leader pledged support for his main rival.

title: Greece Offers Cheaper Power to Farmers to Avert Athens Protest
description: Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis offered farmers lower power bills for the next 10 years, a bid to address their concerns and avoid massive protests in Athens.

title: Estonia Urges EU to Seize Russian Central Bank Assets This Year
description: Estonia is pushing the European Union to seize more than €150 billion ($162 billion) of frozen Russian assets before the end of the year in an effort to lock in lasting policies that stretch beyond the US election cycle.

title: Ukraine Aid Passes US Senate, Faces Uphill Battle in House
description: The US Senate approved $95 billion in assistance for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan after months of delay, but the legislation still faces formidable obstacles in the House.

title: India Plans $9 Billion Rooftop Solar Push as Key Elections Loom
description: India plans to invest about 750 billion rupees ($9 billion) to power 10 million homes with rooftop solar panels, boosting the weakest segment of the country’s booming renewable industry.

title: Streetfighter Putin Waits for the West to Fold on Ukraine
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: Putin Seeks Revenge on a World Order He Once Wanted to Join
description: The KGB agent turned warlord president has shaped Russia with resentment and force. As Donald Trump threatens to abandon NATO allies if he returns to the White House, Putin’s poised to take advantage.

title: GOP Panel Wants to Interview FTC Staff in Probe of Chair Khan
description: House Republicans are demanding transcribed interviews with five senior US Federal Trade Commission officials, doubling down on probes into Chair Lina Khan.

title: Senegal Cuts Mobile Internet Amid Widening Crackdown on Dissent
description: Senegal’s government cut access to mobile internet services for a second time in as many weeks in a widening crackdown on dissent after the authorities postponed presidential elections scheduled for this month.

title: China Opposes ‘Illegal Sanctions’ After Proposed EU Trade Curbs
description: The Chinese flag(L) is draped beside the European Union (EU) during an EU- China Summit at the European Union Commission headquarters in Brussels on June 29, 2015. AFP PHOTO / Thierry Charlier (Photo by THIERRY CHARLIER / AFP) (Photo by THIERRY CHARLIER/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: THIERRY CHARLIER/AFP

title: NATO Defense Spending Rises to Half of Global Total, IISS Says
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine helped pushed global defense spending up 9% to a record 2.2 trillion dollars, with NATO member states accounting for half the total, the International Institute for Strategic Studies said.

title: The Three Candidates Vying to Be Pakistan’s Next Prime Minister
description: When veteran politician Nawaz Sharif returned from exile in London to run in Pakistan’s elections, analysts widely assumed there would only be one outcome: Sharif, blessed by the powerful military, would become prime minister for the fourth time.

title: Russia Expanding Military Edge Over Ukraine, Estonian Spies Warn
description: Russia will likely leverage its advantage in ammunition stockpiles this year and could occupy more Ukrainian territory if crucial aid isn’t delivered to Kyiv, according to an annual report by the Estonian Foreign Intelligence Service.

title: Thai Government Revises Public Debt Management Plan to Add $16 Billion New Borrowing
description: Thailand’s government raised its new borrowing target by 560 billion baht ($15.7 billion) for the current fiscal year to finance budget deficit and new projects.

title: Malaysia Ex-PM Mahathir Hospitalized At National Heart Institute
description: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad is warded at the National Heart Institute once again, according to his office on Tuesday.

title: Kenya’s Eurobond Attracts More Than $5 Billion in Orders
description: Kenya’s latest eurobond issue attracted orders in excess of $5 billion as expectations of lower interest rates in the US fueled demand for the high-yielding securities.

title: OpenAI’s Altman Says UAE Could Be an AI ‘Sandbox’ For the World
description: OpenAI’s Sam Altman said the United Arab Emirates could serve as the world’s “regulatory sandbox” to test artificial intelligence technologies and later spearhead global rules limiting their use.

title: Ukraine Says Dnipro Power Plant Damaged in Russian Drone Attack
description: An energy facility was severely damaged in the central Ukrainian city of Dnipro early on Wednesday in a Russian drone attack, and water and power supply was cut off in several districts.

title: French President Macron’s Unemployment Challenge May Help Marine Le Pen
description: France’s labor market is turning against Emmanuel Macron, raising concerns in his team that the president’s record as an economic reformer can’t counter the rising popularity of Marine Le Pen.

title: Armenia, Azerbaijan Report Troops Killed, Wounded in Clashes
description: Two Armenian military men were killed in small arms fire from the Azerbaijani armed forces, the Defense Ministry in Yerevan said in a website statement early on Tuesday.

title: Britain’s Chronic Housing Shortage Has Become an Election Issue
description: The housing crisis is worsening after the government missed its annual target of building 300,000 homes while demand keeps on increasing. That’s making home affordability a key political battleground before upcoming elections.

title: Tankers Tied to the Russian Oil Trade Grind to a Halt Following US Sanctions
description: A chunk of the vast fleet of tankers that Russia uses to deliver its crude oil is grinding to a halt under the weight of US sanctions, a sign that tougher measures by western regulators might be starting to have tangible effects on Moscow.

title: Former Thai Premier Thaksin Set for Early Release From Jail
description: Thaksin Shinawatra, Thailand’s convicted ex-prime minister, is poised for early release from prison after the justice ministry included him in a list of prisoners eligible for suspended jail terms, the second concession granted to the ex-leader since his return from exile last year.

title: Musk Predicts Putin Can’t Lose in Ukraine, Opposes Senate Bill
description: Elon Musk said “there is no way in hell” that Russian President Vladimir Putin could lose the war in Ukraine, adding: “If he were to back off, he would be assassinated.”

title: Houthis Fire Missiles at Cargo Ship Bound for Iran, Their Patron
description: The Houthi militants in Yemen are backed by Iran, but on Monday they fired missiles at a cargo ship in the Red Sea that was carrying corn to an Iranian port, according to US Central Command.

title: Pakistan Parties’ Coalition Talks Hit Snag Over Who Becomes PM
description: Pakistan’s two main family-controlled political parties hit a snag in their talks to form a new government, as they can’t agree who would become prime minister in their coalition designed to thwart jailed ex-leader Imran Khan.

title: Indonesia’s Next Leader Must Turn EV Dollars Into Jobs, Growth
description: Indonesia’s election on Wednesday is raising questions over whether the nation’s bid to become an electric-vehicle hub poses enough economic benefit to outweigh environmental risks.

title: Biden Creates Task Force on Handling of Classified Documents
description: President Joe Biden is forming a task force to address the issue of classified documents being mishandled during presidential transitions, following a special counsel report that found he had willfully kept such material after he was vice president.

title: Trump Is Considering Endorsement of Daughter-in-Law as RNC Chair
description: Donald Trump is floating the possibility of backing his daughter-in-law, Lara Trump, to help lead the Republican National Committee should the current chairwoman, Ronna McDaniel, step down according to a person familiar with the plans.

title: UK to Sign Nigeria Agreement That Aims to Ease Trade Barriers
description: The UK will today sign a new investment deal with Nigeria that aims to boost bilateral trade and reduce commercial barriers as Britain seeks to strengthen ties with overseas states post-Brexit.

title: Farmers’ Revolt Threatens Election Year Upsets Around the World
description: Agriculture has become a key battleground in a wider culture war over money, food and climate change.
